page.title: 06Exminster Village
page.content:
Exminster is a village situated five miles south-east of Exeter. The electoral roll for the village has 1,750 names. The total population is probably 2,200. It has a long history which goes back to Saxon times when there was an Abbey on the site of the present church. It is said that St. Boniface went to school in this Abbey before going to Germany in the 9th Century.
In 1984 Exminster was bypassed by a new road called Sannerville Road. Exminster is twinned with Sannerille in France. This road was built with money that was given by the European Economic Community. The village is now much quieter because there is less through traffic, but the shops might close because of loss of trade.
